thread.title: One-legged teen wrestler eyeing NCAA title...
thread.title_full: One-legged teen wrestler eyeing NCAA title...

title: One-legged teen wrestler eyeing NCAA title...
text:
One-legged teen wrestler eyeing NCAA title Humankind, USA Today 11:33 a.m. ET March 20, 2017 CLOSE Share Kobey Pritchard is a force to be reckoned with on the wrestling mat. Humankind Kobey Pritchard works on pinning his competitor at a state wrestling tournament in Des Moines, Iowa. (Photo: MICHAEL ROLANDS/RECORD-HERALD) 7 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
INDIANOLA, IA -- Kobey Pritchard has overcome a lot. 
He is a state-level competitive wrestler who is a force to be reckoned with on the mat. 
Training to get to that level takes dedication and self-discipline. For Pritchard, he has the added hurdle of maneuvering with only one leg. 
When Pritchard was in kindergarten, sarcoma forced doctors to remove his leg. The cancer stayed away but the prosthesis was uncomfortable, so he opted for arm crutches. 
Now a teenager, he trains with his crutches, and he trains hard. 
His hands, wrists, and forearms are shaped by callouses that form when you sprint, lift weights and work out on crutches. 
His toughness and determination have taken him far, but heâ€™s not done yet. Pritchard plans on one-day winning an NCAA championship. 
*** 
For more stories like this, LIKE Humankind on Facebook .
